H0.text: Retina is the membrane lining the back of the eye.

H1.text: Lens is the membrane that lines the back of the eye.

H2.text: Cornea is the membrane lining the back of the eye.

H3.text: Aperture is the membrane lining the back of the eye.

A4.text: The retina (from Latin rete 'net'; pl. retinae or retinas) is the innermost, light-sensitive layer of tissue of the eye of most vertebrates and some molluscs.

A5.text: The retina serves a function which is in many ways analogous to that of the film or image sensor in a camera.
